lead_paragraph: Marcus Williams, a backup point guard for the Nets, broke his right foot and will have surgery tomorrow. Rod Thorn, the Nets’ president, said he did not know how Williams was injured. Williams is expected to be sidelined about six weeks, which will cause him to miss training camp. Williams played in 79 games as a rookie last season, averaging 6.8 points and 3.3 assists.
